text: Ataullah Mengal (), popularly known as Sardar Ataullah Mengal, (24 March 1929 â€“ 2 September 2021) was a Pakistani politician. He was the head of the Mengal tribe. He was also the first Chief Minister of Balochistan during Zulfikar Ali Bhutto's premiership from 1 May 1972 to 13 February 1973. In 2009, Sardar Ataullah Khan Mengal was one of many candidates considered for the position of President of Pakistan after the resignation of Pervez Musharraf.Top contenders for office of president Mengal died in Karachi, Sindh on 2 September 2021 from cardiac arrest at the age of 92.Former CM Balochistan Sardar Attaullah Mengal passes away in Karachi. Business Recorder. 2 September 2021. He was suffering from cardiovascular disease.Senior Baloch leader Sardar Ataullah Mengal passes away. Ary News. 2 September 2021. ==References== Category:1929 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Politicians from Balochistan (Pakistan)
title: Ataullah Mengal
